movies.title: Slums of Berlin
movies.plot: A young engineer lies to protect his fiancée, and is later convicted of perjury (after which his fiancée abandons him) and sent to prison. When he gets get, he tries to return to his former life and finds out that's easier said than done--no one wants to hire an ex-con, and when he finds himself broke and homeless, he is "saved" by a local prostitute, and discovers that his only real friends are the people that society deems to be the "lower classes" and "criminals". Just when he is starting to work his way back to "respectability", a situation arises in which he must risk everything he's worked for in order to help out the people who've helped him.
movies.simplePlot: A young engineer lies to protect his fiancée, and is later convicted of perjury (after which his fiancée abandons him) and sent to prison. When he gets get, he tries to return to his former...

biography.bio: Bernhard Goetzke was born on June 5, 1884 in Danzig, Pomerania, Germany. He was an actor, known for Destiny (1921), Dr. Mabuse: The Gambler (1922) and Die Nibelungen: Siegfried (1924). He died on October 7, 1964 in West Berlin, West Germany.
biography.name: Bernhard Goetzke

biography.bio: Paul Bildt was born on May 19, 1885 in Berlin, Germany. He was an actor, known for Louis II de Bavière (1955), Heart of Stone (1950) and Le conseil des dieux (1950). He was married to Katharina Pape and Charlotte Friedländer. He died on March 13, 1957 in West Berlin, West Germany.
biography.name: Paul Bildt

biography.bio: Aud Egede-Nissen was born on May 30, 1893 in Bergen, Norway. She was an actress and producer, known for Dr. Mabuse: The Gambler (1922), Phantom (1922) and Schneeschuhbanditen (1928). She was married to Paul Richter and Georg Alexander. She died on November 6, 1974 in Oslo, Norway.
biography.name: Aud Egede-Nissen

biography.bio: Arthur Bergen was born on October 24, 1875 in Germany. He was an actor and director, known for Yoshiwara, die Liebesstadt der Japaner (1920), Slums of Berlin (1925) and Polizeiakte 909 (1933). He died in 1943.
biography.name: Arthur Bergen

biography.bio: Mady Christians was born in Vienna, Austria. Destined to be in films in both Germany and the US, she started out as a stage actress but soon found new challenges in the world of cinema. Her first film was at the age of 24 when she appeared in Audrey (1916). She remained in German films for the next 17years before coming to the US and starring in The Only Girl (1934). Mady left the film industry in 1948 after finishing All My Sons (1948). She died on October 28, 1951, in Norwalk, CT, from a cerebral hemorrhage.
biography.name: Mady Christians

biography.bio: Christian Bummerstaedt was born in February 1891 in Bremen, Germany. He is an actor, known for Hypocrisie (1927), Wallenstein, 2. Teil - Wallensteins Tod (1925) and Slums of Berlin (1925).
biography.name: Christian Bummerstaedt

biography.bio: Eduard Rothauser was born on December 8, 1876 in Budapest, Austria-Hungary. He was an actor and writer, known for Und das Licht erlosch (1914), Feme (1927) and Der Schrein der Medici (1921). He died on January 24, 1956 in Barcelona, Spain.
biography.name: Eduard Rothauser

biography.bio: Hildegard Imhof was born in 1902. She was an actress, known for Die Buddenbrooks (1923), Slums of Berlin (1925) and Zwei Menschen (1924). She died on July 5, 1946 in Lübeck, Schleswig-Holstein, Germany.
biography.name: Hildegard Imhof

biography.placeOfBirth: Freystadt in Schlesien, Lower Silesia, Germany [now Kozuchów, Lubuskie, Poland]
biography.bio: Margarete Kupfer was born on April 10, 1881 in Freystadt in Schlesien, Lower Silesia, Germany as Margarete Kupferschmid. She was an actress, known for Je ne voudrais pas être un homme (1918), Das deutsche Mutterherz (1926) and Hermanns Erzählungen (1926). She died on May 11, 1953 in East Berlin, East Germany.
biography.name: Margarete Kupfer

biography.bio: Frida Richard was born on November 1, 1873 in Vienna, Austria-Hungary as Friederike Raithel. She was an actress, known for Faust (1926), Phantom (1922) and Die Nibelungen: Siegfried (1924). She was married to Löwit, Josef. She died on September 12, 1946 in Salzburg, Austria.
biography.name: Frida Richard

biography.bio: Frigga Braut was born on September 18, 1889 in Hamburg, Germany. She was an actress, known for Liebeslied (1931), Narkose (1929) and The Stolen Face (1930). She died on February 13, 1975 in Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany.
biography.name: Frigga Braut

biography.bio: Georg John was born on July 23, 1879 in Schmiegel, Poland as Georg Jacobsohn. He was an actor, known for M (1931), The Last Laugh (1924) and Dr. Mabuse: The Gambler (1922). He died on November 18, 1941 in Lódz, Lódzkie, Poland.
biography.name: Georg John

biography.placeOfBirth: Leipzig, Kingdom of Saxony [now Saxony, Germany]
biography.bio: Rudolf Biebrach was born on November 24, 1866 in Leipzig, Kingdom of Saxony. He was an actor and director, known for Falsche Scham - Vier Episoden aus dem Leben eines Arztes (1926), Die Ehe der Luise Rohrbach (1917) and Hundemamachen (1920). He died on September 5, 1938 in Berlin, Germany.
biography.name: Rudolf Biebrach

biography.bio: Aribert Wäscher was born on December 1, 1895 in Flensburg, Germany as Robert Ernst Wilhelm Wäscher. He was an actor, known for The Man Between (1953), It Was a Gay Ballnight (1939) and The Berliner (1948). He was married to Gudrun Genest. He died on December 14, 1961 in West Berlin, West Germany.
biography.name: Aribert Wäscher

biography.bio: Robert Garrison was born on July 18, 1872 in Strassburg, Germany. He was an actor, known for Michael (1924), Dudu, ein Menschenschicksal (1924) and Der Herzensphotograph (1928). He died on January 5, 1930 in Berlin, Germany.
biography.name: Robert Garrison
